summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, responding to discovery requests. The government denies requests for FOIA-related materials and FBI involvement documents, citing lack of legal basis, but provides some materials as a courtesy.

Strauss, as U.S. Attorney, is the lead prosecutor opposing Maxwell's defense team in the criminal case.

events.title: Defense Discovery Request Letter
events.description: Maxwell's defense counsel sent a letter requesting disclosure of FOIA documents, other FOIA request results, and FBI-NY involvement materials.

events.title: Government Letter to Court
events.description: The prosecution detailed the entities that are part of the prosecution team in the Maxwell case, correcting the defense's assertion about the FBI's Florida office.

keyFacts: The defense requested documents produced to Radar Online via a FOIA lawsuit, other FOIA documents related to Epstein/Maxwell investigations, and materials on FBI-NY's involvement in the USAO-SDFL investigation.
The government denied the FOIA-related requests, citing no legal basis under Rule 16 for criminal discovery, and noted such materials are publicly available on the FBI's vault website.
The government provided some materials (cover letters and documents on FBI-NY involvement) as a courtesy, not conceding any legal obligation to do so.
The government corrected the defense's erroneous assertion that the FBI's Florida office was part of the prosecution team, referencing a prior letter to the court.
